function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable sensors may not accurately detect airborne pathogens, leading to false sense of security.","Impact":"Unreliable detection could result in failure to implement appropriate measures to mitigate the spread of the disease.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of wearable sensors, in combination with other detection methods, can help improve accuracy.","Technologies":"Sensor calibration and validation, integration with other detection methods.","People":"General public, healthcare workers.","Owner":"Health authorities, technology developers."},{"Description":"Inadequate privacy measures for sharing COVID-19 electronic medical records (CEMRs) could result in breaches and misuse of sensitive information.","Impact":"Potential compromise of patient privacy and confidentiality, leading to loss of trust in healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust encryption, access controls, and audit trails for secure sharing of CEMRs.","Technologies":"Blockchain-based encryption, access control systems, audit trail mechanisms.","People":"Healthcare organizations, IT security professionals.","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, healthcare institutions."},{"Description":"Inaccurate estimation of outdoor environment occupancy and density may lead to ineffective crowd management and disease transmission control.","Impact":"Failure to implement appropriate crowd control measures, leading to increased risk of disease spread in public spaces.","Mitigation":"Integration of multiple sensors and data validation to improve accuracy of occupancy and density estimation.","Technologies":"IoT sensors, data analytics, machine learning for validation.","People":"Public health authorities, local governments.","Owner":"Technology developers, city administration."}]}
